result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron M Podziemski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $100.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA surcharge assessed-No sample to be provided.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aron M Podziemski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12:00 pm case called. Defendant Aron M Podziemski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 30 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. Complete ID with WCSD.  Appeal Rights Given.

Case called @ 2:36 p.m. Defendant Aron M Podziemski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting adjournment due to a medical issue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 11:15 am.

2:11 pm case called. Defendant Aron M Podziemski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests an adjourment due to pending charges in another county. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Aron M Podziemski in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and is not employed.  Def referred to SPD for eligiblity.  NGP entered by the Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Defendant to meet with SPD today immediately following court.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 02:25 pm.
